job.title: Lead Data Scientist
job.description: <ul><li>We are a big Python shop. Ideally we like folks who worked in Python but will also talk to someone with R background.</li><li>Lead Data Scientist won’t manage a team; hands on individual contributor.</li><li>Comfort in environments where large projects are time-boxed and therefore consequential design decisions may need to be made and acted upon rapidly.</li><li>We like people who has experience with any of these areas: Deep Learning and its many incarnations (e.g., Adversarial Networks, Convolutional Networks, Recurrent / Recursive / Residual Nets), Natural Language Processing (NLP), image recognition, anomaly detection, speech recognition, time-series forecasting, geospatial modeling, Bayesian Networks or Bayesian inference more generally, Reinforcement Learning, Unsupervised techniques, or other data science and statistical tools and methods.</li><li>Candidates with fluency in the mathematical ‘primitives’ and generalizations of data science – e.g., expertise in Linear Algebra, and Vector Calculus usually do well.</li><li>Solid theoretical grounding in the mathematical core of the major ideas in data science</li></ul>
